meanings.definition: Having good fortune or success by chance.
meanings.sent1: She felt lucky to find a penny on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: He considered himself lucky to win the raffle.
meanings.sent3: The lucky cat statue brought good fortune to the shop owner.
meanings.sent4: Her lucky charm seemed to attract success wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The lucky horseshoe symbolized good fortune in the old tales.

meanings.sent1: The lucky student received a scholarship for college.
meanings.sent2: They were lucky to have such supportive friends.
meanings.sent3: It was lucky that the rain stopped just in time for the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The lucky break in his career changed his life forever.
meanings.sent5: She felt lucky to be part of such a wonderful team.

meanings.sent1: The lucky penny she carried always brought her good luck.
meanings.sent2: Wearing her lucky socks, she aced the exam.
meanings.sent3: The lucky charm on his keychain protected him from harm.
meanings.sent4: The lucky bamboo plant in the office was believed to bring prosperity.
meanings.sent5: Finding a four-leaf clover is considered a lucky omen.

meanings.sent1: It was lucky that they bumped into each other at the store.
meanings.sent2: The lucky encounter led to a lifelong friendship.
meanings.sent3: By a lucky coincidence, they both chose the same restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The lucky timing of the bus arrival saved him from being late.
meanings.sent5: She made a lucky guess and won the game.
